```{r}
rm(list=ls())
library(rjags)
library(bayesplot)
library(jagsUI)
library(kdensity)
```

```{r}
# Load data
data = read.csv("../Dataset/gdp_inflation.csv", header=T)
data$DATE         = as.Date(data$DATE)
data$GDP_PC1      = as.numeric(data$GDP_PC1)
data$CPIAUCSL_PC1 = as.numeric(data$CPIAUCSL_PC1)
```

```{r}
modelARMA.string <-"model {
  ## Parameters: alpha, tau, m0
  # Likelihood
  Yp[1]  <- mu[1]
  mu[1]  <- Y[1]
  eps[1] <- Y[1] - mu[1]
  for (i in 2:N) {
    Y[i]   ~ dnorm(mu[i], tau)
    Yp[i]  ~ dnorm(mu[i], tau)      # Prediction in sample
    mu[i]  <- m0 + alpha * Y[i-1] + theta * eps[i-1]
    eps[i] <- Y[i] - mu[i]
  }
  
  # Prediction out of sample 
  ypOut[1]  ~ dnorm(muOut[1], tau)
  muOut[1]  <- m0 + alpha * Y[N] + theta * eps[N]
  epsOut[1] <- ypOut[1] - muOut[1]
  for (k in 2:Npred) {
    ypOut[k] ~ dnorm(muOut[k], tau) 
    muOut[k] <- m0 + alpha * ypOut[k-1] + theta * epsOut[k-1]
    epsOut[k] <- ypOut[k] - muOut[k]
  }
  
  sigma2 <- 1/tau
  
  # Prior 
  alpha ~ dunif(-1, 1)
  theta ~ dunif(-1, 1)
  tau ~ dgamma(2, 0.1)
  m0    ~ dnorm(0.0, 1.0E-4)
}"
```

```{r}
# Prepare data
Ntot  = dim(data)[1]
Npred = round(0.1 * Ntot) # Horizon for out-of-sample prediction
N     = Ntot - Npred

data_subsample = data[1:N, ]

line_data_GDP <- list("N" = N,
                      "Npred" = Npred,
                      "Y" = data_subsample$GDP_PC1)

outputmcmcARMA_GDP <- jags(model.file = textConnection(modelARMA.string),
                         data = line_data_GDP,
                         parameters.to.save= c("alpha", "theta", "sigma2", "m0", "Yp", "ypOut"), 
                         n.adapt=1000, n.iter=10000, n.chains = 3, n.burnin = 1000)

line_data_CPIAUCSL <- list("N" = N,
                           "Npred" = Npred,
                           "Y" = data_subsample$CPIAUCSL_PC1)

outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL <- jags(model.file = textConnection(modelARMA.string),
                              data = line_data_CPIAUCSL,
                              parameters.to.save= c("alpha", "theta", "sigma2", "m0", "Yp", "ypOut"), 
                              n.adapt=1000, n.iter=10000, n.chains = 3, n.burnin = 1000)
```

```{r}
mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("alpha"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("alpha"),  prob = 0.95)
mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("theta"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("theta"),  prob = 0.95)
mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("sigma2"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples, pars = c("sigma2"),  prob = 0.95)

autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples[,c("alpha")],main="alpha GDP")
autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples[,c("theta")],main="theta GDP")
autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples[,c("sigma2")],main="sigma2 GDP")

mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("alpha"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("alpha"),  prob = 0.95)
mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("theta"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("theta"),  prob = 0.95)
mcmc_trace(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("sigma2"))
mcmc_areas(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples, pars = c("sigma2"),  prob = 0.95)

autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples[,c("alpha")],main="alpha CPIAUCSL")
autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples[,c("theta")],main="theta CPIAUCSL")
autocorr.plot(outputmcmcARMA_CPIAUCSL$samples[,c("sigma2")],main="sigma2 CPIAUCSL")
```

```{r}
t  = seq(1,Ntot)
tt = seq(1,N)

#
yp=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$mean$Yp
q1=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$q2.5$Yp
q2=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$q97.5$Yp

#
plot(t, data$GDP_PC1, col="red",ylab="mu_t",
     main="data (red), in samp.pred. (blue)")
lines(t, data$GDP_PC1,col="red")
points(tt, yp,pch="*", col="blue")
lines(tt, q1, type="l",col="blue", lwd = 1.5)
lines(tt, q2, type="l",col="blue", lwd = 1.5)

#
yp_pred=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$mean$ypOut
q1_pred=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$q2.5$ypOut
q2_pred=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$q97.5$ypOut

#
plot(t, data$GDP_PC1, col="red", ylab="mu_t", ylim=c(min(q1_pred),max(q2_pred)),
     main= "out-of-sample prediction (orange)")
abline(v=N,col="orange")
lines(tt, yp, type="p", pch="*", col="blue",)
lines(tt, q1, type="l", col="blue", lwd = 1.5)
lines(tt, q2, type="l", col="blue", lwd = 1.5)
points(seq((N+1),Ntot,1),pch="*",yp_pred,col="orange")
lines(seq((N+1),Ntot,1),q1_pred,col="orange",lwd = 1.5)
lines(seq((N+1),Ntot,1),q2_pred,col="orange",lwd = 1.5)
```

```{r}
ARMA_gdp <- arima(data$GDP[1:275], order = c(1,0,1))
print(ARMA_gdp)
ARMA_gdp_fit <- data$GDP[1:275] - residuals(ARMA_gdp)
plot(tt, yp, type="p", pch="*", col="blue",)
points(ARMA_gdp_fit, type = "l", col = 2, lty = 2)

alpha.mcmc.mat=as.matrix(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples[,c("alpha")], iters = FALSE)
yalpha=kdensity(alpha.mcmc.mat)
plot(yalpha,main="posterior of alpha")
abline(v=ARMA_gdp$coef[1],col="green")
abline(v=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$mean$alpha,col="blue")

theta.mcmc.mat=as.matrix(outputmcmcARMA_GDP$samples[,c("theta")], iters = FALSE)
ytheta=kdensity(theta.mcmc.mat)
plot(ytheta,main="posterior of theta")
abline(v=ARMA_gdp$coef[2],col="green")
abline(v=outputmcmcARMA_GDP$mean$theta,col="blue")

predict_gdp <- predict(ARMA_gdp, n.ahead=30)
predict_gdp$pred
ts.plot(data$GDP_PC1)
points(ARMA_gdp_fit, type = "l", col = 2, lty = 2)
points(predict_gdp$pred, type = "l", col = 'orange', lty = 2)
```
